summary: Evelio Duque is a Cuban citizen who arrived in Quito, Ecuador, in 1966. He is mentioned in several cables related to anti-Castro activities and potential connections to drug trafficking. Documents suggest he may have been involved with anti-Castro groups and met with drug traffickers in Central America. Specifically, he is mentioned in connection with Alfredo Ordonez Gonzalez, a drug trafficker, in Guayaquil after Gonzalez traveled through Mexico, Guatemala, and Costa Rica. Station traces were requested on Duque, along with Herminio Diaz, to investigate their activities and affiliations.
significance: Evelio Duque's significance in the JFK context is primarily related to his alleged involvement in anti-Castro activities and potential connections to drug trafficking, as revealed in CIA cables. While the documents do not directly link him to the JFK assassination, his association with individuals and groups involved in these activities could be of interest in understanding the broader network of individuals and organizations with motives and means related to the assassination.
